1.verse_text: Jerusalem, once so crowded, lies deserted and lonely. This city that was known all over the world is now like a widow. This queen of the nations has been made a slave. flood her cheeks. None of her former lovers are there to offer comfort; and are now her enemies. suffering in a foreign land, with no rest from sorrow. Their enemies captured them because no one travels there to celebrate the festivals. The city gates are deserted; priests are weeping. Zion is in sorrow! and live as they please. The Lord has punished Jerusalem because of her awful sins; he has let her people be dragged away. Her leaders are like deer that cannot find pasture; they are hunted down till their strength is gone. that once was theirs; now they suffer and are scattered. No one was there to protect them from their enemies who sneered when their city was taken. have made the city a joke. Those who once admired her now hate her instead– she has been disgraced; she groans and turns away. but she wasn't worried about what could happen. And when Jerusalem fell, it was so tragic. No one gave her comfort when she cried out, 'Help! I'm in trouble, Lord ! The enemy has won.' Jerusalem saw foreigners enter her place of worship, though the Lord had forbidden them while searching for food; they trade their valuables for barely enough scraps to stay alive. Jerusalem shouts to the Lord , 'Please look and see how miserable I am!' Why doesn't someone notice my terrible sufferings? You were fiercely angry, Lord , and you punished me worst of all. that burned in my bones; you set a trap for my feet and made me turn back. All day long you leave me in shock from constant pain. and they weigh so heavily that my strength is gone. You have put me in the power of enemies too strong for me. my warriors and crushed my young heroes. Judah was a woman untouched, but you let her be trampled like grapes in a wine pit. and tears flood my eyes. No one is here to comfort or to encourage me; we have lost the war– my people are suffering. but no one offers comfort. The Lord has turned the neighboring nations against Jacob's descendants. Jerusalem is merely a filthy rag to her neighbors. but I refused to obey him. Now I ask all of you to look at my sufferings– even my young people have been dragged away. but they betrayed me. My priests and my leaders died while searching the city for scraps of food. how upset I am, our Lord ? My stomach is in knots, and my heart is broken because I betrayed you.
